oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Color Of The Blues - George Jones performance - 1957
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance of Color Of The Blues, written by George Jones and Lawton Williams, produced by Harold "Pappy" Daily, recorded in 1957 at Bradley Film and Recording Studio in Nashville, TN, released by Mercury Starday on January 15, 1958, and performed by George Jones (vocal and guitar), Grady Martin (guitar), Buddy Emmons (steel), Shorty Lavender (fiddle), Tommy Jackson (fiddle), and Floyd Cramer (piano).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Jones
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) George Jones performs "Color Of The Blues" [incomplete]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Williams, Lawton, 1922-2007; Jones, George, 1931-2013; Daily, Pappy, 1902-; Bradley Studios; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Emmons, Buddy; Lavender, Shorty; Jackson, Tommy; Cramer, Floyd, 1933-1997
